column4: hi - i am trying to make ubuntu on a usb stick and i need to actually install on the stick (as a real system, not as a livecd).  trouble is, it doesn't boot...  i have tried every trick with grub i can think of and it still won't boot.  however system created with usb-creator does boot.  any clues or suggestions?
to "truely" install onto USB, one of the last options during install is to customize GRUB, and you need to point it manually to the USB drive (it will point to HD by default)
i don't recall that option, where would it be?
Advanced maybe?  I'm not sure of the wording actually.
ok i try again.. thx
the usb-creator sets up a fat32 file system on the stick (and that boots) - do i have to use fat for a real install or should it work with ext4?
you don't need FAT for a real install you can use ext4 if you want.
does it make any sense to use swap on a stick?
if you want hibernate then yes, if you have enough RAM and don't need hibernate then you could try without it...
swap will shorten the life of the stick
i am going to be using it on a laptop that has no harddisk and only 384M ram
that isn't a whole lot of memory...  you "might" want some swap - it's up to you though.
ok i found the boot loader option.  it is asking "device for boot loader installation" - i presume this is where to write the boot loader?  should it be /dev/sdb or /dev/sdb1 ?
assuming the USB is sdb then /dev/sdb --- the sdb1 is a parition you DON'T want that, you want it on MBR of drive.
well i didn't do that last time...  fingers Xed this works now
it booted!! but i have to interrupt the boot to feed it a grub option - i pressed esc and e repeatedly and it didn't hear me - what do i need to do?
i've NEVER used a modem with linux before, but i know a lot of "Win-modems" don't work.  have you checked that your modem works in linux?
if you aren't familiar with modems you need to read th docs
ok sorry.
is key ring coming up everytime for nm_applet?
my wifi wont work until i enter password
move rather then delete the current keyring settings - then the next time keyring should re-prompt, choose the Insecure storage option and it will stop asking.
move? where?  why?
